title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description: In the Java editor, the process of reverting a file is significantly slower than closing and reopening the file.
OB: The observed behavior is that when I perform the first set of steps (revert the file), it takes about 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: This seems odd, since reverting the file contents should not take longer than closing and reopening the file, which only takes about 8 seconds.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 

1) Open an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository. 
2) Select the end of the first line and add a space character to mark the file as dirty. 

On my machine, it takes about 8 seconds to perform the following steps: 
3) Click on the close box in the editor tab. 
4) Answer 'no' to the 'Do you want to save changes' dialog. 
5) Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. 

However, if I repeat steps 1) and 2), and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
